1.name: Jeanne d'Arc
1.description: A divinely inspired peasant woman becomes an army captain for France and then is martyred after she is captured.

2.name: Sherlock Holmes Baffled
2.description: Sherlock Holmes enters his drawing room to find it being burgled, but on confronting the villain is surprised when the latter disappears. Holmes initially attempts to ignore the event by ...                See full summary »

3.name: Indian Club Swinging, High School Girls

4.name: Nouvelles luttes extravagantes
4.description: Right in front of our very eyes, two attractive and feminine women metamorphose into two professional wrestlers who begin a no-holds-barred wrestling match.

5.name: The Enchanted Drawing
5.description: A cartoonist defies reality when he draws objects that become three-dimensional after he lifts them off his sketch pad.

6.name: The House That Jack Built
6.description: A cleverly conceived picture of a little boy and girl with building blocks. The little girl has erected a pretty structure, which the boy proceeds to demolish with pokes of his fingers. ...                See full summary »

7.name: Grandma's Reading Glass
7.description: A boy looks through glasses at various objects, seen magnified.

8.name: As Seen Through a Telescope
8.description: An elderly gentleman in a silk hat sits on a stool in front of a store on the main street of town. He has a telescope that he focuses on the ankle of a young woman who is a short distance ...                See full summary »

9.name: Attack on a China Mission
9.description: The titles tell us this film is based on an incident in the Boxer Rebellion. A man tries to defend a woman and a large house against Chinese attackers. They attack with swords, guns, and ...                See full summary »

10.name: Le livre magique
10.description: When this picture opens, you see a large book mounted on an easel. An old student is seen poring over old manuscripts when he advances toward the book, and by the aid of some mysterious ...                See full summary »

11.name: L'homme orchestre
11.description: A band-leader assembles an orchestra by mystifying means.

13.name: L'illusioniste double et la tête vivante
13.description: A man comes onto the stage through the fireplace, divides himself, and sits on stools on either side of a table. He places a woman's head on the table and a hat on her head. She speaks to ...                See full summary »

14.name: The Kiss
14.description: Nothing new, but an old thing done over again and done well. Some one has attempted to describe a kiss as "something made of nothing," but this is not one of that kind, but one of those old...                See full summary »

15.name: Faust and Marguerite
15.description: Marguerite is seated before the fireplace, Faust standing by her side. Mephistopheles enters and offers his sword to Faust, commanding him to behead the fair Marguerite. Faust refuses, ...                See full summary »

16.name: How It Feels to Be Run Over
16.description: In one glorious point-of-view shot, a vehicle dashes full-speed into an ill-starred passer-by.

18.name: Beheading a Chinese Boxer
18.description: In China at the turn of the 20th century there was a rebel group called the Society of the Harmonious Fist, otherwise known as Boxers. They attacked westerners and any Chinese who ...                See full summary »

20.name: Soldiers of the Cross
20.description: The plot outlined the story of the early Christian martyrs with a compendium of horrors guaranteed to jolt audiences into an awareness of terrible suffering for the sake of Christianity. ...                See full summary »

21.name: Chez le photographe
21.description: A man turns up to have his photograph taken. He and the photographer have different views concerning the composition of the photo.

22.name: Spanish Bullfight
22.description: With a crowded arena in the background, a stationary camera records a bull charging a picador astride his horse. An attendant on foot throws stones at the rump of the horse to get it to ...                See full summary »

23.name: Le déshabillage impossible
23.description: As if by magic, a weary traveller trying to undress, is foiled by his mutinous clothes as they teleport and multiply before his eyes, refusing to stay on the clothing rack.

24.name: Explosion of a Motor Car
24.description: As two couples enjoy their evening promenade in a nice but rickety open motor car, without notice, an explosion blows the vehicle to smithereens.

25.name: Chimmie Hicks and the Rum Omelet

26.name: Cyrano de Bergerac
26.description: The only film record ever made of the original star of Rostand's famous play performing a scene from his most famous role. It is accompanied by a sound-on-cylinder recording of Coquelin's voice reciting one of Cyrano's speeches.

27.name: Le réveil d'un monsieur pressé
27.description: A man wishing to catch a train, and having left himself none too much time to do so, rises from his couch and proceeds to don his garments. These, however, change in a most fearful manner, ...                See full summary »

28.name: Above the Limit
28.description: A man seems to be at the races, rooting for his favorite number.

30.name: Le repas fantastique
30.description: A man and two women sit down to eat dinner, but several unexpected surprises prevent them from their repast: the legs of the table grow, the table disappears into the floor, and a ghostly spirit appears and takes possession of the man.

31.name: Le rêve de Noël
31.description: The entire story of Christmastide is here depicted. The scene opens in a large boudoir of an apparently wealthy man's home. His children, assisted by their governess, are about to retire. ...                See full summary »

32.name: Let Me Dream Again
32.description: A man dreams he is flirting with an attractive young lady, then he wakes up in bed next to his wife.

33.name: Romeo and Juliet
33.description: Emilio Cossira singing a tenor aria from Gounod's Roméo et Juliette, probably 'Ah. Lève-toi soleil'.

34.name: A Nymph of the Waves
34.description: A woman in ballet slippers wearing a large white hat and a long white dress - with ruffles, puffy sleeves and petticoats - dances across water with roiling waves behind her. She holds the ...                See full summary »

35.name: Mining Operations
35.description: "Showing the blowing up of military mines by the English Royal Engineers. The tremendous effect of the explosion is clearly shown."

36.name: The Clown and the Alchemist
36.description: Although we are led to believe that the ancient alchemists were all powerful, this picture somewhat reverses the order of things. The clown plays some wonderful pranks on the old professor....                See full summary »

37.name: The Mystic Swing
37.description: The professor shows his power to Mephisto by mysteriously placing a young lady in a swing. Mephisto then shows his power by making the young lady disappear from the swing, to the surprise ...                See full summary »

38.name: Spiritisme abracadabrant
38.description: Falling into the same perplexing predicament that doomed the hapless travellers in Le déshabillage impossible (1900), and L'auberge ensorcelée (1897), an unsuspecting man is harassed by an annoying poltergeist. Can he outsmart it?

41.name: Le rêve du radjah ou La forêt enchantée
41.description: The picture opens with the Sultan lying down to rest on his luxurious cushioned couch. The scene changes to the grounds around the palace. An odd-looking tree appears in the foreground and ...                See full summary »

42.name: Uncle Josh's Nightmare
42.description: Poor Uncle Josh is trying to get to sleep, but being constantly bedeviled by a fellow in red long underwear with horns. A short early trick editing film using a stationary camera.

43.name: Chapellerie et charcuterie mécanique
43.description: Filmmaker Alice Guy creates something of an oddity with this one-minute comedy. An inventor and his assistant create a machine that, true to its title, makes hats and grinds sausages! The ...                See full summary »

44.name: Le départ d'Arlequin et de Pierrette
44.description: Preserved by Filmoteca de Catalunya, Barcelona, PIERRETTE'S ESCAPADES retains the original hand-tinting from the film's release in 1900. Director Alice Guy adapts a brief sequence from the ...                See full summary »

46.name: Tom Whisky ou L'illusioniste toqué
46.description: A man attempts to sit on a stool, only to find a woman has magically appear to steal his place. This happens again and again. Soon, more amazing transformations occur.

48.name: Le tonneau des danaïdes
48.description: Dainaid demonstrates that he can fit 8 women into a magic barrel.

49.name: Le village de Namo - Panorama pris d'une chaise à porteurs
49.description: A black and white short in which a moving rear facing camera documents people running towards it on the street.
